result.execSummary:
The defendant Beau R. Ames was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Huber for all purposes

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Beau R. Ames

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 04:04 pm - GBA for PFO - Defendant Beau R. Ames in court.   Defendant owes $443 - to date has made zero payments.  Defendant states was incarcerated until last week - requests extension.  Court grants extension.  Review hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Beau R. Ames in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:02
State moves to amend to mis theft 943.20(1)(A) - Granted - Plea questionnaire filed- No contest plea -   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty
Michlig/Hogan/Court statement to sentencing - Court sentences to 20 days jail - huber for all purposes- commence on/before 3-18-15@ 8am  - CC/DNAAS totalling $443 
Appeal rights given  Review hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Concerning scheduling of second preliminary hearing
Pre-trial conference on March 3, 2015 at 11:00 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

02:41 pm - Defendant Beau R. Ames in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hogan statement to status of case.  Hogan petitions court for preliminary hearing.  Prelim time limits waived.  Bail continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Beau R. Ames
Current: 203 Kemp Street, Rhinelander, WI 54501 United States  (Effective: 11-11-2014)
Prior: 210 Harmony Hills Court, Rhinelander, WI 54501

02:41 pm - Defendant Beau R. Ames in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michlig states Cirilli recently represented defendant - however due to conflict Cirilli had to withdraw.  Michlig has not met with defendant to resolve case.  Court questions Ames as to status of obtaining new attorney - Defendant provides current address of 203 Kemp Street, Rhinelander, WI  54501.  Was not aware of Cirilli's withdrawal until just recently.  Is trying to retain Melms.  Will also contact PD's office due to change in financial status.  Defendant requests redoing the preliminary hearing - Court refers defendant to discuss with new counsel.  Bail continued.  Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Mr. Ames stopped in requesting his PTC be postponed as he is looking for another attorney.  Explained he should continue his search and appear in court on 11/11 with or without his new attorney and explain to the court his difficulty in finding one, should that be the case.

03:19 pm - Defendant Beau R. Ames in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State files Information.  Cirilli in receipt of Information, waives reading and enters not guilty plea.  Bail continued.  Cirilli will request transcript of prelim and file motion if appropriate within 10 days of receipt.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 11, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
1 - Golden Karat Appraisal; 2 - Hodag Gun & Loan receipt

10:20 a.m. Defendant Beau R. Ames in court. Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Ames statement-requests adjournemnt/has been in touch with an attorney. Court denies adjournment. Michlig calls Deputy Dey, ONSO, sworn, direct. State's Exh. 1 (Golden Karat appraisal) marked, offered, received. State's Exh. 2 (Hodag Gun & Loan receipt) marked, offered, received. Witness identifies defendant. Michlig statement. Court finds probable cause exists and binds defendant over for trial. Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Beau R. Ames in court.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule
3:20
Defendant has not yet obtained counsel - will proceed on own at this time - waiver/benefits of counsel free and voluntary- Court will set for preliminary hearing - Defendant waives time limits
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 27, 2014 at 09:45 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 02:36 pm - Defendant Beau R. Ames in court.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  Defendant states ineligible for PD - requests additional time to hire counsel.  Bail continued.  PFAC filed - Court reviews - Petition denied.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

02:08 pm - Defendant Beau R. Ames in court.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
